msItem.rubric: Text I: the words sälam and Ṣadǝqan and their abbreviations and other few words (fol. 7ra); elements of the Ethiopic numerals and of the punctuation signs. Texts II-III: Nomina sacra; the names of the Trinity; the names of the protagonists: sämaʿtatä Ṗäraqliṭos and ṣadǝqan; a few lines alternating with black lines on the incipit page of Texts II and III and on fol 13v (incipit page of the account proper of Text II); the exhortation sǝmʿu... in Text II; incipit of each miracle (Text III). Elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals or their elements; elements of the text dividers.

msItem.note: - Throughout Text I and sometimes in Texts II (s., e.g., fol. 13va ls.9-10) and III (s., e.g., fol. 59ra, incipit of miracle 4), the Martyrs of Ṗäraqliṭos are called ṣadǝqan “righteous ones”. It is an unknown group of saints coming, according to Text II (fol. 13va ls. 5-6), from Tiberias (Ṭǝbǝryados).
Text II (Gädlä sämaʿtatä Ṗäraqliṭos)
- The 4th of Säne is mentioned as the day of the martyrdom (commemoration date) of the martyrs of Ṗäraqliṭos (fol. 21ra-rb).
- The number of martyrs is reported to have been 777 (fol. 21rb).
Text III (Täʾamrä sämaʿtatä Ṗäraqliṭos)

III-1) Miracle of the divine punishment (birds drinking human being’s brains) (fols. 48vb-51vb) (፩ተአምሪሆሙ፡ ለሰማዕታተ፡ ጰራቅሊጦስ፡ ጸሎቶሙ፡ ወበረከቶሙ፡... ወኮነ፡ በቀ[fol. 49ra]ዳሚ፡ መዋዕል፡ አመ፡ ተምዐ{ዓ}፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ መዓተ፡ ዐቢየ፨ ወፈነወ፡ አዕዋፈ፡ ዐበይተ፡ እለ፡ ይሴፅሩ፡ ርእሰ፡ ሰብእ፡ በአፉሆሙ፡ ወይሰትዩ፡ ናላሁ፡ ...)
III-2) Miracle of the jar with holy water that did not break (fols. 51vb-53ra) (፪ተአምሪሆሙ፡ ለሰማዕታተ፡ ጰራቅሊጦስ፡ ... ወካዕበ፡ ነሥአ፡ ውእቱ፡ ብእሴ፡ እግዚኣብሔር፡ ገብረ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ኵስኵስተ፡ ቤ[fol. 52ra]ተ፡ መቅደስ፡ ከመ፡ ይቅዳሕ፡ ማየ፡ ጸሎት፡ …)
III-3) Miracle of the healing of Queen ʾƎgziʾ Kǝbra (fols. 53ra-59ra) (፫ተአምሪሆሙ፡ ለሰማዕታተ፡ ጰራቅሊጦስ፡ ... [fol. 53rb] ወካዕበ፡ ስምዑ፡ አኃውየ፡ ዘገብሩ፡ ላቲ፡ ቅዱሳን፡ ጻድቃን፡ ለእግዚእ፡ ክብራ፡ በእሲተ፡ ንጉሠ፡ ኢትዮጵያ፡ ...)
III-4) Miracle of the healing of a blind man (fols. 59ra-60vb) (፬ተአምሪሆሙ፡ ለጻድቃን፡ … ወሖረ፡ ፩ብእሲ፡ ዕዉረ፡ ዐይን፡ እንዘ፡ ይመርሕዎ፡ እምድረ፡ በለሰ፤...)

III-5) Miracle of the holy water of Ṗäraqliṭos extinguishing fire in the King’s palace at ʾAwagär (fols. 60vb-61vb) (፭ተአምሪሆሙ፡ ለሰማዕታተ፡ ጰራቅሊጦስ፡ ... ስምዑ፡ ኦአኃውየ፡ ዘከመ፡ ቦአ፡ እሳተ፡ ሰማይ፡ ወስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ዐቢይ፡ ዘምድረ፡ አ[ዋ]ገር፡…)
III-6) Miracle of the holy water of Ṗäraqliṭos saving from the pest (fols. 62ra-63va) (፮ተአምሪሆሙ፡ ለሰማዕታተ፡ ጰራቅሊጦስ፡ ... ወመጽአ፡ ፩ብእሲ፡ እምድረ፡ ምምሳሕ፡ እንተ፡ ይብልዋ፡ ጕንያ፡ ጐዪዮ፡ እምፍርሃተ፡ ብድብድ፡ …)

III-7) Miracle of the church bell stolen from Ṗäraqliṭos and restituted (fols. 63va-68ra) (፯ተአምሪሆሙ፡ ለሰማዕታተ፡ ጰራቅሊጦስ፡ ... ወካዕበ፡ ስምዑ፡ ኦአኃውየ፡ ዘገብረ፡ ተአምረ፡ ወመንክረ፡ ጳራቅሊጦስ፡ መንፈ[fol. 63vb]ሰ፡ ሕይወት፡ ወረድኤቶሙ፡ ለሰማዕታት፡ ኅሩያን፡ ወቦአ፡ ፩ብእሲ፡ በድፍረት፡ ኀበ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወነሥኣ፡ ለዶለ፡ ኀጺን፡…)
III-8) Miracle of the healing of a blind woman (fols. 68ra-69va) (፰ተአምሪሆሙ፡ ለሰማዕታተ፡ ጰራቅሊጦስ፡ ... [fol. 68rb] ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ዕውርተ፡ ዐይን፡ እምጕንዱይ፡ መዋዕል፡...)

III-9) Miracle of the holy water of Ṗäraqliṭos saving from the pest and men from Mǝsʿǝma and Hagäray (fols. 69va-73ra) (፱ተአምሪሆሙ፡ ለሰማዕታተ፡ ጰራቅሊጦስ፡ ... ስምዑ፡ ካዕበ፡ ኦአኃውየ፡ ዘከመ፡ ጐዩ፡ ፪ዕደ[fol. 69vb]ው፡ እምፍርሃተ፡ ብድብድ፡ዘቦአ፡ ውስተ፡ ሀገሮሙ፡ ወመጽኡ፡ ኀበ፡ መቃብሪሆሙ፡ ለሰማዕታተ፡ ጳራቅሊጦስ፡ ቅዱሳን፡ ፩እምድረ፡ ምስዕማ፡ ወ፩እምድረ፡ ሀገራይ፡…)

III-10) [miracle numbered 11] Praise for the church and the martyrs of Ṗäraqliṭos, and list of the provinces from where the faithful come to Ṗäraqliṭos (fols. 73ra-76vb) (፲፩ተአምሪሆሙ፡ ለሰማዕታተ፡ ጰራቅሊጦስ፡ ... [fol. 73rb] ስምዑኬ፡ ኦአኃውየ፡ ከመ፡ ናብጽሕ፡ ለክሙ፡ በዐቅሙ፡ ኵሎ፡ ዘይገብሩ፡ በታሕተ፡ ሰማይ፡…)

III-11) [miracle numbered 12] Extensive praise for the church, description of the angels surrounding Ṗäraqliṭos etc. (fols. 77ra-84vb) (፲፪ተአምሪሆሙ፡ ለሰማዕታተ፡ ጰራቅሊጦስ፡ ... [fol. 77va] ስምዑኬ፡ ኦአኃውየ፡ ከመ፡ እንግርክሙ፡ ዘየዐቢ፡ ወዘይኄይስ፡ እምዝ፡ ሰማዕክሙ ቀዳሚ፡...).
- Fols. 84rb-86vb: Embedded colophon.

Fol. 84rb: ተፈጸመት፡ ዛቲ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ አመ፡ ሠላሁ[sic]፡ ለወርኀ፡ ጳዮን፡ ዘውእቱ፡ ወርኀ፡ ሰኔ፡ በ፻፸ወ፭ዓመተ፡ ምሕረት፡ በመዋዕ[fol. 84va]ለ፡ መንግሥቱ፡ ለንጉሥነ፡ ልብነ፡ ድንግል፨ ወጳጳስነ፡ አቡነ፡ ማርቆስ፨ ወሊቀ፡ ጳጳስነ፡ አባ፡ ዮሐንስ፨ ወሥዩመ፡ ዐጋሜ፡ ናታን፡ ለባሴ፡...ወቀሲስ፡ ገ[fol. 84vb]በዝ፡ ተስፋ፡ ሕይወት፨...ወግርማ፡ ጽዮን፡ ጸሃቂ፡ ዘተስእለኒ፡ ከመ፡ እጽሐፍ፡ ዛተ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ እንዘ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ይረድእ፡ ወቃሎ፡ ያጸንዕ፡...[fol. 85rb l.13]ወጸሓፊሃኒ፡ ተስፋ፡ ጽዮን፡ ዘአ[fol. 85va]ገበርክዎ፡ ከመ፡ ይጽሐፍ፡ ዘንተ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ አእሚርየ፡ ጥበቡ፨ ወዘአዕለውክዋ፡ አነ፡ ዳንኤል፡ ፈላሲ፨ ወበምግባርየሰ፡ ኃጥእ፡ ወአባሲ፨ ወበትምህርትየሰ፡ ሠርፀ፡ ነቢያት፡ በዜና፡ ወወልደ፡ ሐዋርያት፡ በሃይማኖት፡ ዘፄወወኒ፡ ጳ[fol. 85vb]ራቅሊጦስ፡ መንፈሰ፡ ሕይወት፨ ከመ፡ አጽሐፍ፡[sic] ተአምራቲሆሙ፡ ለሰማዕታቲሁ፡ ቅዱሳን፨ ወዘአብጽሐተኒ፡ ኀበዝ፡ እምየ፡ አመ፡ ማርያም፡...

The colophon states that the work was completed in the month of Śäne, year of mercy 175 (= 1523 A.D), in the time of King Lǝbnä Dǝngǝl (r. 1508-1540), Metropolitan Marqos (d. 1529-30), Archbishop John XIII of Alexandria (1483-1555) and governor of ʿAgame (śǝyumä ʿagame) Natan.

Furthermore, it says that Danʾel “the fälasi” (“the stranger, the wanderer”) is the one who has “translated” (zä-ʾaʿläwkǝwwa) the work (Gädlä and Täʾamrä sämaʿtatä Ṗäraqliṭos), who is at the same time the one who has written this colophon (ወዘአዕለውክዋ፡ አነ፡ ዳንኤል፡ ፈላሲ፨ “I myself, Danʾel the stranger, am the one who have compiled it”). It says, besides, that Täsfa Ṣǝyon (fol. 85rb ls.13-14) is the name of the scribe whom Danʾel has commissioned to write down the work (ወጸሓፊሃኒ፡ ተስፋ፡ ጽዮን፡ ዘአገበርክዎ፡ ከመ፡ ይጽሐፍ፡ ዘንተ፡ መጽሐፈ፡).

msItem.colophon: Fol. 87ra: ተፈጸመ፡ በዝየ፡ ገድለ፡ ስምዖሙ፡ ወተአምሪሆሙ፡ ለሰማዕታተ፡ ጰራቅሊጦስ፡ ቅዱሳን፡ በሠርቀ፡ ታይፍ፡ ወርኅ፡ አመ፡ ፩ለሐምሌ፨ በ፱ሠርቀ፡ ሌሊት፡ ጸሎቶሙ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስሌነ፡ ወምስለ፡ ተክለ፡ ጊዮርጊስ፡ ባዕለ፡ ብራና፡ [fol. 87rb] አሜን፨ ለዘ፡ ጸሐፎ፡ ወለዘ፡ አጽሐፎ፡ ወለዘ፡ አንበቦ፡ ወለዘ፡ ተርጐሞ፡ ወለዘ፡ ሰምዐ፡ ቃላቲሁ፡ ኅቡረ፡ ይምሐሮሙ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ በመንግሥተ፡ ሰማያት፡ በጸሎቶሙ፡ ለሰማዕታት፡ አሜን፨ The note mentions the 1st of Ḥamle as the date in which the Ms. was completed. Most probably this date refers to the completion of the entire book (with binding, sewing, etc.), which is just the month after the date (Śäne) mentioned in the colophon of the work (s. “Other datails”). Since the year is here not mentioned, one can guess that it is the same as mentioned in the colophon of the work (year of mercy 175); it could not been excluded that this single Ms. is the first exemplar of the texts on the Martyrs of Ṗäraqliṭos. In this note, it is also given the name of Täklä Giyorgis as the owner of the parchment (bǝranna).

ሰላ፡/ሰ፡ for ሰላም፡

Hand a: fols. 7ra-10vb, characterized by short and slightly right-sloping letters.
- ቶ and ቆ have the loop marking the 7th order set up directly at the horizontal stroke (e.g., fols. 8va l.13, 10rb l.3).
Hand b: fols. 11ra-87rb, characterized by uniform, tall, slender and rounded letters.
- ጵ has the 6th order marker set up on the vertical stroke at the top, oriented to the left (e.g., fol. 66vb l.8).
- the number ፲ appears occasionally in the form with a ring attached to the right side through a horizontal stroke (fol. 77ra);
- the number ፮ is with the loop open, looking like “compressed” ፯ (e.g., fol. 62ra).

list.item: Fols. 2ra-5vb: Register of those who make the commemoration of the Martyrs of Ṗäraqliṭos.Fol. 2ra: ጸሐፍና፡ አስማቲሆሙ፡ ለእለ፡ ይገብሩ፡ ተዝከሮሙ፡ ለሰማዕተ፡ ጳራቅሊጦስ፡... In this note, the name Ṗäraqliṭos is written as Ṗaraqliṭos.
Fols. 5vb-6vb: Sälam-hymn for the Martyrs of Ṗäraqliṭos.Fol. 5vb: ሰላም፡ ለክሙ፡ ሰማዕታተ፡ ጰራቅሊጦስ፡ ናር፡ እለ፡ ጥብርያዶስ፡ ብሔር፡… The note is crudely written in a 16th-cent. (?) hand. Abbreviation used: ሰ፡ for ሰላም፡

Fol. 44vb (above): Note on the commemoration of the Martyrs of Ṗäraqliṭos (?). Fol. 44vb: ወቀዳሚ፡ ዘገብረ፡ ተዝካሮሙ፡ አቡየ፡ ሄኖክ። The note, written in a hand very similar to the main one (the same?), states that "my father" Henok is the first one to have done “their commemoration”. Possibly it is the end of Additio 1.

Fol. 44vb(below): Supplication for the scribe (?).Fol. 44vb: ወዛቲ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ዘፃሕየየ። ይፃሕይይ። ወይጽሐፍ። ስሞ፡ ውስተ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ሕይወት። ወኢትርሥዕዎ፡ ፩፩አቡነ፡ ዘበሰማያት። The note has been written over an erasure. For ḍaḥyäyä,s. LesDic 553b.
Fol. 86vb: Short note (biblical quotation?). Fol. 86vb: <...> ሠናየ፡ ግበሩ፡ ቢጸክሙ፡ አፍቅሩ፡ እስመ፡ ዘአ[ፍ]ቀረ፡ ቢጾ፡ ይነሥእ፡

- Title (ጻድቃን?) is crudely written in green on the front board. - Corrections written interlineally: e.g., fols. 7va, 8ra, 8rb, 8va, 8vb, 9va, 10va, 21vb, 57rb, 68ra, 71va. - The preposition በ is written, interlineally or in the margins, as correction for several words on fol. 43va-vb. - Erasures: e.g., fols. 36ra, 61rb. - Corrections written over erasures: e.g., fols. 14va, 20rb, 30va, 389ra, 67vb. - Immediate corrections marked by dots above and below the word and crosses in between, as on fol. 43ra, or by parallel lines, as on fol. 21rb. - Lacunas in Texts II and III: fols. 18vb, 33va, 38vb, 87rb, 87rb (?). - Cues for the rubricator: e.g., fols. 31v, 32r, 36v, 38v, 53v, 62r. - Crude drawing in pencil on fol. 1v and crude notes in pen on fols. 39r and 87v. - Personal names, i.e. Gäbrä Hiwet and Gäbrä Mikaʾel, are crudely written on fol. 87v (bottom margin).

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards. Two pairs of sewing stations. Remains of the leather cover are visible on the inner side of both boards.
Small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires, close to the tail and the head of the codex.

origin.origDate: S. the colophon. Quire I (Text I) was added in a later period (17th cent.?).
